| Word | Lemma | Part of Speech | Gender | Number | Person | Tense | Mood | Note | |---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|---| | Io | io | pron. | | sg. | 1st | | | | | fei | fare | v. | | sg. | 1st | past | indicative | | | gibetto | gibetto | n. | m. | sg. | | | | | | a | a | prep. | | | | | | | | me | me | pron. | | sg. | 1st | | | | | de | di | prep. | | | | | | | | le | lo | art. | f. | pl. | | | | | | mie | mio | adj. | f. | pl. | 1st | | | | | case | casa | n. | f. | pl. | | | | |
Note:
* "fei" is an archaic form of the past tense of "fare". * "gibetto" is a gibbet, a gallows. * "a me" is a dative pronoun, meaning "to me". * "de le" is a contraction of "di" and "le", meaning "of the". * "mie" is the feminine plural form of the possessive adjective "mio", meaning "my".
